RulesPage.title: Club Rules and Safety Guides
RulesPage.subtitle: Our principles for safe, respectful, and unforgettable adventures. Please read carefully before your first outing.
RulesPage.safety1: Know Your Limits: Always choose routes that match your fitness level and experience. It's okay to turn back.
RulesPage.safety2: The Ten Essentials: Always carry navigation, sun protection, insulation, illumination, first-aid supplies, a fire starter, repair kit & tools, nutrition, hydration, and an emergency shelter.
RulesPage.safety3: Check the Weather: Always check the forecast before you leave. Be prepared for sudden changes, especially at high altitudes. Use our Weather Center!
RulesPage.safety4: Communicate Your Plan: Tell someone your route plan, including your itinerary and expected return time. Stick to the plan.
RulesPage.lnt1_content: Know the regulations and special concerns for the area you'll visit. Travel in small groups and repackage food to minimize waste.
RulesPage.lnt2_trigger: 2. Travel and Camp on Durable Surfaces
RulesPage.lnt2_content: Stay on established trails and campsites. Avoid creating new trails. Good campsites are found, not made.
RulesPage.lnt3_content: Pack it in, pack it out. This includes all trash, leftover food, and litter.
RulesPage.lnt4_content: Preserve the past: observe, but do not touch, cultural or historic structures and artifacts. Leave rocks, plants, and other natural objects as you find them.
RulesPage.lnt5_content: Use a lightweight stove for cooking. Where fires are permitted, use established fire rings and keep fires small. Burn all wood and coals to ash, put out campfires completely, then scatter cool ashes.
RulesPage.lnt6_content: Observe wildlife from a distance. Never feed animals. Store food and trash securely.
RulesPage.lnt7_content: Yield to other users on the trail. Take breaks and camp away from trails and other visitors. Let nature's sounds prevail; avoid loud voices and noises.
RulesPage.etiquette1: Be Punctual: Respect the trip leader and fellow members by arriving on time for all meetups.
RulesPage.etiquette2: Stay Together: Hike at a pace the whole group can manage. Keep the person behind you in sight and don't get too far ahead of the group.
RulesPage.etiquette3: Inclusive Community: We are committed to fostering a welcoming and inclusive environment for everyone. Harassment and exclusionary behavior will not be tolerated.
